#  How to use Amazon Brand Analytics – 2023 Guide

Understanding your customers is key to success. That’s why Amazon provides
sellers with an invaluable tool: Amazon Brand Analytics.

## What is Amazon Brand Analytics Tool?

Amazon Brand Analytics is an essential tool for any third-party seller
participating in the Amazon Brand Registry programme. This tool provides
valuable information about customer search and purchase behaviour, as well as
the most viewed ASIN products on Amazon. Not only that, but it is also an
essential resource that allows you to delve deeper into the world of Amazon
data. With this tool, you can get detailed information about how customers
interact with your products and your competitors’ products on the Amazon
marketplace.

## Difference between Amazon Brand Analytics and Amazon Brand Store Insights

It is important to know that Amazon Brand Analytics and Amazon Brand Store
Insights are two different things on Amazon. Amazon Brand Store Insights
focuses on providing brands with valuable information about the performance of
your brand shop on Amazon. This includes data on page views, unique visitors,
sales and conversion rates in your brand shop. This information is vital for
optimising your shop layout, product offerings and marketing strategies, all
with the goal of improving your brand’s overall performance on Amazon. On the
other hand, Amazon Brand Analytics Tool focuses on providing Amazon sellers
with information about customer search and purchase behaviour, as well as the
most viewed ASIN products. This tool is not related to the performance of your
branded shop itself. The amazing thing is that you don’t even need to have a
branded shop on Amazon to take full advantage of this tool.

## Who can use Amazon Brand Analytics?

Accessibility to Amazon Brand Analytics Tool is one of the most frequently
asked questions. To take advantage of this valuable tool, you must meet
certain criteria:

  * You must be an active seller on Amazon.
  * You must be the owner of a registered trademark.
  * You cannot simply be a reseller of the product you are selling; it must be your own branded product.
  * You must be enrolled in the Amazon Brand Registry programme.

What if you don’t have an active trademark for the brand you own? The good
news is that if you are enrolled in the Amazon Brand Registry programme, you
can still use Amazon Brand Analytics. This flexibility is a valuable resource
for a wide range of sellers on the platform.

## **How do I access Amazon Brand Analytics?**

Accessing **Amazon Brand Analytics** is simple. You just need to log into your
**Seller Central** account, and from there, go to the reports section. Within
the reports, you will be able to select the Amazon Brand Analytics option and
explore all available reports. Once inside the tool, you will have access to a
variety of reports and data that will allow you to make informed decisions to
grow your Amazon business.

## **The importance of data**

The data provided by Amazon Brand Analytics is essential to understand and
improve the performance of your products on the Amazon marketplace. This data
not only allows you to understand what is happening, but also gives you the
tools you need to take concrete and strategic action. Imagine you have a
product that is not ranking as well as expected on Amazon, resulting in lower
visibility for marketplace users. In many cases, this happens due to an
insufficient or poorly implemented analysis phase. This is where Amazon Brand
Analytics Tool becomes invaluable.

## What does Amazon Brand Analytics include?

Amazon Brand Analytics provides a series of detailed reports to help you make
informed decisions for your Amazon business. These reports include:

  1. **Amazon Search Terms Report:** This report shows you the keywords that shoppers use to find products on Amazon. Knowing these keywords is essential to optimising your listings and attracting more customers.
  2. **Demographic Report:** Get information about your customers’ demographics, including their age, household income, education level, gender, and marital status. This information allows you to tailor your marketing and pricing strategies to your audience.ç **Product**
  3. **Comparison Report:** Find out which products customers see after visiting your listings. This helps you understand your customers’ shopping preferences and adjust your catalogue accordingly.
  4. **Alternative Purchase Report:** Analyse which products customers buy after visiting your listings. This gives you valuable information about your customers’ buying preferences and allows you to identify cross-selling opportunities.
  5. **Shopping Basket Report:** With this report, you can identify which products are most frequently purchased along with your products. This information helps you create product bundles and cross-selling strategies.
  6. **Repeat Purchase Behaviour Report:** Find out which products are popular with repeat customers. This allows you to focus your marketing efforts on the products that generate brand loyalty.

## Benefits of Amazon Brand Analytics

Amazon Brand Analytics is a powerful tool that can help you drive sales of
your products on Amazon. Some of the key benefits include:

  * Understand what types of products are selling and why.
  * Identify niches for your brand and fine-tune your catalogue.
  * Anticipate buying trends.
  * Benchmark your brand against competitors.
  * Finding advertising opportunities.

These benefits translate into more informed and strategic decision making,
which can have a significant impact on the success of your business on Amazon.

## Key metrics to track in Amazon Brand Analytics

To use Amazon Brand Analytics effectively, it is important to pay attention to
certain key metrics:

  1. **Search Impressions:** This tells you what words customers use to find your products. You can take advantage of tools and **optimise your listings with AI and ChatGPT**.
  2. **Purchases:** It is important to make sure that customers buy your products after viewing them.
  3. **Add to Cart:** This shows that customers are interested in your products, but not yet buying them.
  4. **Top Keywords:** These are the words that customers use to search for products. Knowing them is useful to improve your lisnitng.
  5. **Click Through Rate:** Tells you how many times your products are clicked on after searching for them.
  6. **Audience Demographics:** Knowing who your customers are helps you sell to them better.
  7. **Repeat Purchases:** Knowing which products your customers buy frequently helps you focus your sales efforts.
